text: Guess where I am?  I am on a boat!

Good Morning. We are indeed on a boat today, 
 because we are leaving the North Island,
and we are sailing accross the Cook Strait to go to the South Island.
Welcome to Picton and the South Island.
This morning we are doing kind of a drive by city tour of Christchurch.

Now I'm sure a lot of you guys know about 
 all the earthquakes that have happened here,

beacause last year I was here was in January 
 which was just before the second earthquake

which really shook up the city. As you can see behind 
 me most of it has been blocked off

and you can't geet to it. Very eerie feeling 
 you get when you look at the town
because.. it is just so sad when you see everything that was...
Hi. So right now we are driving through Arthur's Pass
basically to get from Christchurch all the way to Franz Joseph area.

As you can see behind me it is one of 
 the most beautiful parts of New Zealand.
I love driving through the Southern Alps. It is just spectacular.
Driver: We are coming up to a part of this pass called the rollercoaster.
It is a little bit windy, a little bit up and down. Brace yourselves.

So right now we stopped at a Jade factory 
 to look at some pure New Zealand jade.
Jade is really important to Maori people because they believe

if you rub a piece of jade, part of 
 you goes into the stone and

when you give the stone to someone else part 
 of you will always be with them.
That is very touching, very beautiful. Lets take a look.
Hi. Its really warm. I'm at a hot pool. It's hot. Its 38 degrees.
